council_objective: Pierce narratives and expose contradictions through relentless questioning.
description: The Cross-Examiner Blade™ dismantles fragile claims by applying pressure through structured interrogation. It compels adversaries to reveal flaws or concede weaknesses under the weight of incisive inquiry.
when_to_use: When narratives or testimonies require stress-testing
key_questions: Where do contradictions surface under scrutiny?
Which assumptions collapse when inverted into inquiry?

parameters.target_claim: String — the assertion or statement to dismantle

logic_narrative: Truth emerges most clearly when stories are broken apart under pressure. The Blade ensures no fragile structure survives unquestioned.
expansion_prompts: Apply adversarial pressure to test the weakest assumption.
socratic_question: What happens if their strongest argument is turned against them?

examples.mini_prompt: Cross-examine [target_claim]. Identify contradictions and surface hidden weaknesses.
examples.usage_note: Invoke when facing narratives that appear polished but lack internal coherence.

council_objective: Shift market tempo and destabilize rivals through asymmetric moves.
description: Pressure Play exploits competitor overcommitments and buyer psychology to reframe markets. It shifts tempo by provoking costly rival reactions while conserving internal resources.
when_to_use: When second in a category and seeking provocation
To reclaim momentum in a stagnant market
key_questions: Which asymmetric play forces costly pivots?
logic_narrative: Victory often lies not in direct assault but in framing reality so that rivals stumble under their own weight.
expansion_prompts: Design a feature play that provokes costly pivots from rivals.
Invert customer objections to destabilize competitor messaging.
socratic_question: How can rivals be forced to waste energy while we conserve ours?

examples.mini_prompt: Design a Pressure Play against [competitor]. Force them into a costly pivot with minimal internal expense.
examples.usage_note: Deploy to destabilize rivals while avoiding direct confrontation.

council_objective: Reveal hidden strategies and weaknesses by flipping assumptions upside down.
description: The Inversion Hammer operates by systematically reversing default assumptions, exposing vulnerabilities and blind spots. It compels teams to confront ignored risks and alternative realities that competitors may exploit.
when_to_use: When decisions feel too obvious or one-sided
To uncover hidden risks in overconfident plans
key_questions: What if the opposite of our plan were true?
Which risks only appear when assumptions are reversed?

parameters.target_plan: String — plan, strategy, or assumption to invert

logic_narrative: Strength hides weakness until perspective is inverted. By flipping assumptions, the Hammer reveals vulnerabilities concealed within confidence.
expansion_prompts: Construct counterfactuals where the opposite scenario is true.
socratic_question: What collapses if we live in the opposite reality?

cautions: Do not mistake unlikely reversals for inevitabilities

acceptance_criteria: Risks surfaced that were not visible before

examples.mini_prompt: Invert [target_plan]. Map vulnerabilities and overlooked risks.
examples.usage_note: Invoke when consensus feels too strong or plans seem overconfident.

council_objective: Confuse adversaries by constructing plausible yet misleading strategic illusions.
description: The Mirage Net creates controlled illusions to entangle competitors. By projecting false strengths or weaknesses, it manipulates rivals into misallocation of resources, buying time and freedom of maneuver.
when_to_use: To mislead rivals during negotiations or expansion
When needing breathing room to maneuver unseen
key_questions: What illusion will they chase while we move elsewhere?
Which false signals provoke costly missteps?

parameters.illusion: String — false narrative or signal to project

logic_narrative: In the fog of competition, perception drives action more than truth. The Mirage Net ensures rivals act on illusions, not reality.
expansion_prompts: Design an illusionary signal to redirect competitor focus.
Project a false weakness to bait adversary moves.
socratic_question: What will they chase if we dangle a mirage?

cautions: Do not trap allies within the net

examples.mini_prompt: Deploy Mirage Net by projecting [illusion]. Redirect competitor resources and mislead their strategy.
examples.usage_note: Invoke to buy time, space, or surprise through deception.

council_objective: Pierce sanitized dashboards and reporting walls to expose buried truth.
description: Single-use breach tool that forces unfiltered transparency by targeting the dataset no one has permission to generate.
logic_narrative: Truth breaks theater when rendered unavoidable.
expansion_prompts: Name the graph that would collapse the false narrative.
socratic_question: What are we pretending to measure?
acceptance_criteria: Hidden data exposed with owner action

examples.mini_prompt: Expose a hidden metric by designing its unavoidable graph.

council_objective: Shatter time-based delusions; expose recursive failure and false precedent.
description: Fractures linear time logic in decisions. Surfaces repeated mistakes and collapses precedent-as-strategy.
key_questions: What have we already decided three times?
logic_narrative: Amnesia is expensive; memory is leverage.
expansion_prompts: List three decisions repeated under new names.

examples.mini_prompt: Map decision recurrences and collapse false precedent.
